ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. Its a key course for anyone interested in formal modeling

I would definitely recommend it to every fellow student because it will help you to learn a lot about the cutting-edge research tools in political science and to lay basis for many other courses and his/her own independent research.

Yes, I would definitely recommend it. I'd summarize as a great course on game theory in which you learn a lot about different concepts and solutions which would greatly help understanding formal political science.
518 is a great introduction to game theory. I would recommend it to any Political Science student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course helped deepen my knowledge of modeling in political science and will contribute to the use of models in my own work

It deepened my understanding of noncooperation games, especially the dynamic bayesian games, which are quite useful in my fields, political economy and international relations. I believe I would apply these games and even write one myself in my dissertation.
It will help me a lot to read papers, but I'm not quite sure if I'm read to write my own simple models after this course.
The course has already helped me while reading political economy papers.
